definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
official records/grade (of goods)/file/records/shelves/slot/gap/crosspiece/classifier for crosspieces/classifier for events, affairs etc/Taiwan pr. [dang3]

sentences.english: The Oscars will be broadcast during prime time.
sentences.chinese: 奥斯卡的颁奖典礼会在黄金档的时间播出。

sentences.english: They will compare notes about cartoons, Nickelodeon, or prime-time programming.
sentences.chinese: 他们会就卡通，点唱机或者黄金档节目交换意见。

sentences.english: Many satellite TV stations will ban the costume drama at prime time. What is your opinion?
sentences.chinese: 各大卫视黄金档禁播古装剧，你又怎么看这件事情呢？

sentences.english: “The movement is not ready for prime time, ” he says.
sentences.chinese: 这场运动还上不了黄金档。

definition: satellite TV (abbr. for 衛星電視|卫星电视[wei4 xing1 dian4 shi4])
to broadcast/to air (a TV program etc)
to broadcast over a network/(radio or TV) hookup/simulcast
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
iQiyi, online video platform based in Beijing, launched in 2010
to replay/to rerun/(agriculture) to reseed/to oversow
